intro: Nothopegia heyneana, commonly known as the white sand pine, is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its slender, often twisted trunk and small, leathery leaves. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is typically found in lowland and mountainous regions. Its cones are woody and contain small, winged seeds that are dispersed by wind. Nothopegia heyneana plays a role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and contributing to biodiversity in its native range.
